conductance

hydroroot.conductance.compute_K(g, scale_factor=1.0)[source]

Compute the conductance in dimension \([L^3 P^{-1} T^{-1}]\) from the experimental one which is in \([L^4 P^{-1} T^{-1}]\)

Parameters

  • g (MTG) : the root architecture

  • scale_factor (float) : a factor used for sensitivity analysis

Returns

  • g (MTG) : with the property K calculated from property K_exp and the length of the vertex

In each vertex K = K_exp * scale_factor / vertex_length

hydroroot.conductance.compute_K_from_Poiseuille(g, nb_xylem=5, radius_scale=0.1)[source]

Deprecated Compute the axial conductances (K) in a MTG according to Poiseuille law.

The conductance depends on the radius of each xylem pipe, the number of xylem pipes, and on the length of a root segment.

radius_scale allows to compute the radius of a xylem pipe from the radius of a root segment.

hydroroot.conductance.compute_K_from_laws(g)[source]

Deprecated Compute the axial conductance from empirical laws (hard coded) according to the distance from the tip and to the root type, either seminal, crown or lateral

Parameters

  • g (MTG)

set property K

hydroroot.conductance.compute_k(g, k0=300.0)[source]

Compute the radial conductances (k) of each segment of the MTG.

Parameters

  • g (MTG) : the RSA

  • k0 (float) or (string): the radial conductance for one element of surface in \(micronL/s.MPa.m^2\)

if k0 == ‘k0’: calculation using k0 from g.property(‘k0’) if k0 is a float: value used in calculation

k radial (microL/s.MPa) calculation:

k = 2 pi r l k0 with l and r the segment length and radius

hydroroot.conductance.fit_K(g, s=0.0)[source]

Deprecated

hydroroot.conductance.fit_property(g, x, y, prop_in, prop_out, s=3.0)[source]

Deprecated Fit a 1D spline from x, y data.

Retrieve the values from the prop_in of the MTG. And evaluate the spline to compute the property ‘prop_out’

hydroroot.conductance.fit_property_from_csv(g, csvdata, prop_in, prop_out, k=1.0, s=0.0, plot=False, direct_input=None)[source]

Deprecated Fit a 1D spline from (x, y) csv extracted data or from direct input dictionnary

Retrieve the values it will be applied to from the prop_in of the MTG. And evaluate the spline to compute the property ‘prop_out’

Toggle plot option to visualize the spline fit

hydroroot.conductance.fit_property_from_spline(g, spline, prop_in, prop_out)[source]

compute a property from another one using a spline transformation.

Retrieve the values from the prop_in of the MTG. And evaluate the spline to compute the property prop_out

Parameters

  • g (MTG)

  • spline (class scipy.interpolate.UnivariateSpline) : 1-D smoothing spline fit to a given set of data points

  • prop_in (string) : the property data

hydroroot.conductance.poiseuille(radius, length, viscosity=0.001)[source]

Deprecated Compute a conductance of a xylem element based on their radius and length.

parameters

  • radius (float) : (m) radius of a xylem tube

length (float) : (m) length of a xylem element

viscosity (float) : (Pa.s) dynamic viscosity of the liquid

The poiseuille formula is:

:math:` conductance =

rac{pi r^4}{8 mu L }`

with \(r\) the radius of a pipe, \(\mu\) the viscosity of the liquid, \(L\) the length of the pipe.

See also

http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Poiseuille

Download the source file ../../src/hydroroot/conductance.py.
